One possible solution is to develop and widely distribute low-cost, high-quality spectacles and contact lenses that are affordable to everyone.
Another solution could be to invest in research and development of new technologies, such as implantable lenses or contact lenses that can be inserted directly into the eye.
People with poor vision could also learn to adapt to their condition by developing better visual skills, such as improved depth perception, contrast sensitivity, and visual memory.
In some cases, people with poor vision might be able to improve their vision through natural means, such as dietary supplements, exercise, and stress reduction techniques.

Finally, it is important to note that the disappearance of glasses and contact lenses would not necessarily mean that everyone with poor vision would be able to see clearly. Some individuals may still require corrective surgery or other medical interventions to improve their vision.
